articles.description:
Ben Thompson, writing last week about the four legislative proposals released by the House Subcommittee on Antitrust:
I don‚Äôt think it is an accident that these bills were presented as
a package, but I think it has been a mistake in a lot of coverage
to view the package as one bill. It seems to me that Chairman
Cicilline has played his cards very deftly here: start with the
fact that while every bill was authored by a Democrat, they all
have a Republican co-sponsor; if some combination of these
regulations pass they will likely be with overwhelmingly
Democratic support, but the fact they are starting out as
nominally bi-partisan efforts is savvy.
The real tell about Cicilline‚Äôs strategy, though, is the seeming
contradictions between his own bill and that of Representative
Jayapal. Cicillin‚Ä¶
articles.title: David Cicilline‚Äôs Anchoring Strategy

articles.description:
Dan Rayburn, writing for Streaming Media Blog:
On Monday, Apple announced some new privacy features in iCloud,
one of which they are calling Private Relay. The way it works is
that when you go to a website using Safari, iCloud Private Relay
takes your IP address to connect you to the website and then
encrypts the URL so that app developers, and even Apple, don‚Äôt
know what website you are visiting. The IP and encrypted URL then
travels to an intermediary relay station run by what Apple calls a
‚Äútrusted partner‚Äù. In a media interview published yesterday, Apple
would not say who the trusted partners are but I can confirm,
based on public details (as shown below; Akamai on left, Fastly on
the right), that Akamai, Fastly and Cloudflare are being used.
It‚Äôs a little weird that Apple doesn‚Äôt want to talk about who these ‚Äútrusted partners‚Äù are, because if we don‚Äôt know who they are, how are we supposed to trust them? Putting your name on a product or service is a badge of trust.
¬†‚òÖ
articles.title: Apple‚Äôs ‚ÄòTrusted Partners‚Äô for iCloud Private Relay Include Akamai, Fastly, and Cloudflare

I am Magneto, and I would like to register a complaint. Frankly,
all of these new mutants are terrible. [‚Ä¶]
I met the people who were saying that metal objects now stuck to
them because of their vaccines and gave them a whole recruitment
speech about how they were the next stage in evolution, but once I
said the word ‚Äúevolution,‚Äù they looked at me doubtfully. Then I
asked them to show off their abilities, and‚Äâ‚Äî‚ÄâI hate to say this
but, have you ever been at a friend‚Äôs amateur magic show, where
the magic show is not going quite as was hoped, and there‚Äôs a lot
of saying ‚Äúhold on‚Äù and ‚Äúwait, hang on‚Äù and ‚Äúsorry‚Äù as they fail
several times running to identify your card, and then a dead bird

We have our first nomination for the 2021 Pulitzer for commentary.

articles.description:
The New York Times:
As the Justice Department investigated who was behind leaks of
classified information early in the Trump administration, it took
a highly unusual step: Prosecutors subpoenaed Apple for data from
the accounts of at least two Democrats on the House Intelligence
Committee, aides and family members. One was a minor.
All told, the records of at least a dozen people tied to the
committee were seized in 2017 and early 2018, including those of
Representative Adam B. Schiff of California, then the panel‚Äôs top
Democrat and now its chairman, according to committee officials
and two other people briefed on the inquiry. Representative Eric
Swalwell of California said in an interview Thursday night that he
had also been notified that his data had been subpoenaed. [‚Ä¶]
Moreover, just as it did in investigating news organizations,
the Justice Department secured a gag order on Apple that expired
this year, according to a person familiar with the inquiry, so
lawmakers did not know they were being investigated until Apple
informed them last month.
Adam Schiff:
Trump repeatedly demanded the DOJ go after his political enemies.
It‚Äôs clear his demands didn‚Äôt fall on deaf ears.
This baseless investigation, while now closed, is yet another
example of Trump‚Äôs corrupt weaponization of justice.
And how much he imperiled our democracy.
¬†‚òÖ
articles.title: Trump Department of Justice Subpoenaed Apple for Records of Democrats and Their Family Members

articles.description:
Joe Rossignol, writing for MacRumors:
On the macOS Monterey features page, fine print indicates
that the following features require a Mac with the M1 chip,
including any MacBook Air, 13-inch MacBook Pro, Mac mini, and iMac
model released since November 2020:
Portrait Mode blurred backgrounds in FaceTime videos
Live Text for copying and pasting, looking up, or translating
text within photos
An interactive 3D globe of Earth in the Maps app
More detailed maps in cities like San Francisco, Los Angeles,
New York, and London in the Maps app
Text-to-speech in more languages, including Swedish, Danish,
Norwegian, and Finnish
On-device keyboard dictation that performs all processing
completely offline
Unlimited keyboard dictation (previously limited to 60 seconds
per instance)
Apple has not explained why any of these features are not
available on Intel-based Macs. For what it‚Äôs worth, Google Earth
has long offered an interactive 3D globe of the Earth on
Intel-based Macs both on the web and in an app.
I don‚Äôt think Apple has to explain. These features all clearly are built on code that uses features exclusive to Apple Silicon. E.g. for Portrait Mode in FaceTime, it uses the M1 imaging pipeline‚Äâ‚Äî‚Äâthe same thing that makes all FaceTime footage on the M1 MacBooks look so much better than on any Intel MacBook, even though the camera hardware is the same. The speech/dictation features on this list are surely using the Neural Engine, something Intel Macs don‚Äôt even have.
¬†‚òÖ
articles.title: Some New MacOS 12 Monterey Features Are Unavailable on Intel-Based Macs

articles.description:
Good overview of one of this week‚Äôs biggest announcements from Dave Hamilton for The Mac Observer:
Apple‚Äôs iCloud Private Relay works similar to a VPN in that it
routes your traffic through other servers, hiding your IP address
from the websites you visit, and hiding your traffic from whomever
manages your local network. Where it differs is that a VPN is
generally just one server between you and the website you‚Äôre
visiting. With a VPN, your traffic takes the route of You ‚ÜîÔ∏é VPN
Server ‚ÜîÔ∏é Website. Private Relay adds another server to the
mix, which ensures that no one in the chain‚Äâ‚Äî‚Äânot even Apple‚Äâ‚Äî‚Äâcan see the whole picture: You ‚ÜîÔ∏é Apple‚Äôs Ingress Server ‚ÜîÔ∏é
Content Provider‚Äôs Egress Server ‚ÜîÔ∏é Website.
This is, as Apple calls it in their ‚ÄúGet Ready for iCloud Private
Relay‚Äù WWDC Session on the topic, ‚ÄúPrivacy by Design.‚Äù
Apple made specific mention that while the ‚ÄúIngress Proxy‚Äù servers
are run by Apple, the ‚ÄúEgress Proxy‚Äù (aka the server which
communicates with the websites you visit) is not controlled by
Apple and is under the control of ‚Äúa (trusted) content provider‚Äù.
This means that Apple doesn‚Äôt know what site(s) you‚Äôre visiting,
and the third-party content provider doesn‚Äôt know who you are.
I‚Äôm using this on both an iPhone and iPad running the new OS betas, and it doesn‚Äôt seem to slow anything down. I did run into a problem where initially, both devices were saying I needed to upgrade to a paid iCloud account to enable the feature in Safari (also for Mail‚Äôs new tracker privacy protection), even though I‚Äôve got an Apple One family account. I ‚Äúfixed‚Äù that by restarting both devices after poking around the iCloud section in Settings. Not a bad bug for a developer beta 1‚Äâ‚Äî‚Äâjust figured I‚Äôd mention it here in case anyone else runs into it.
¬†‚òÖ
articles.title: Digging Into Apple‚Äôs iCloud Private Relay

articles.description:
Not a lot new this year, but this one jumped out to me:
5.1.1(v): Apps supporting account creation must also offer account deletion.
I don‚Äôt see how anyone could disagree that this is a good rule. There‚Äôs a lot to complain about in the App Store Guidelines but there‚Äôs also a lot that‚Äôs unambiguously pro-user.

articles.title: What‚Äôs New in the App Store Review Guidelines

articles.description:
Alex Heath, for The Verge:
Facebook is taking a novel approach to its first smartwatch, which the company hasn‚Äôt confirmed publicly but currently plans to debut next summer. The device will feature a display with two cameras that can be detached from the wrist for taking pictures and videos that can be shared across Facebook‚Äôs suite of apps, including Instagram, The Verge has learned.
A camera on the front of the watch display exists primarily for video calling, while a 1080p, auto-focus camera on the back can be used for capturing footage when detached from the stainless steel frame on the wrist. Facebook is tapping other companies to create accessories for attaching the camera hub to things like backpacks, according to two people familiar with the project, both of whom requested anonymity to speak without Facebook‚Äôs permission.
Sounds right. A tiny concealable camera to take surreptitious photos that upload to Facebook sounds exactly like something Mark Zuckerberg came up with himself.
¬†‚òÖ
articles.title: The Verge: ‚ÄòFacebook Plans First Smartwatch for Next Summer With Two Cameras‚Äô

articles.description:
I enjoy doing these quick hits on CNBC. I get on, I get a few questions, I answer as best I can, and I‚Äôm out. Two tidbits on my spot today:
It seems like a widespread misconception that iCloud+ is a new additional paid tier. It‚Äôs not: ‚ÄúiCloud+‚Äù is now just a name for any paid tier of iCloud, even the $1/month tier. If you pay anything at all for iCloud, you get iCloud+ features like the new Private Relay feature for Safari.


Another question was about the relative dearth of AR announcements. I pointed to Maps, which is clearly moving in a very AR direction with turn-by-turn directions. But another big AR announcement from Apple this week is RealityKit 2, with 3D Object Capture using nothing more than your iPhone or iPad camera. (Or a DSLR or drone camera.) This makes creating AR objects based on real-world objects several orders of magnitude easier, faster, and more accessible.




¬†‚òÖ
articles.title: Yours Truly on CNBC‚Äôs TechCheck Today

articles.description:
Eddy Cue, in an interview with Micah Singleton for Billboard:
One of the first people that told me about Dolby Atmos was Adam
Levine. I happen to know him, and we were in the same place, so he
was like, ‚ÄúHave you listened to this?‚Äù And he sends me this song
and he was really excited. He said, ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe what I can do
with this.‚Äù It‚Äôs going to be really exciting to see how this
evolves, and all of what artists are going to be able to do with
this, and how exciting it is for fans and listeners to be able to
do this.
So we went after the labels and are going to the artists and
educating them on it. There‚Äôs a lot of work to be done because
we have, obviously, tens of millions of songs. This is not a
simple ‚Äútake-the-file that you have in stereo, processes through
this software application and out comes Dolby Atmos.‚Äù This
requires somebody who‚Äôs a sound engineer, and the artist to sit
back and listen, and really make the right calls and what the
right things to do are. It‚Äôs a process that takes time, but it‚Äôs
worth it. [‚Ä¶]
To me, when I look at Dolby Atmos, I think it‚Äôs going to do for
music what HD did for television. Today, where can you watch
television that‚Äôs not in HD?
One of the advantages music has over television is you can‚Äôt take
an old TV show and truly up-res it to HD because it was shot on
low-quality cameras. But in the case of audio, all these things
were recorded on multiple tracks, and so it‚Äôs possible to go back
to a lot of the songs and be able to do this.
The article is behind Billboard‚Äôs ‚ÄúPro‚Äù paywall on their website, but the full interview is available on Apple News‚Äâ‚Äî‚Äâand it seems to work even if you‚Äôre not a News+ subscriber.
¬†‚òÖ
articles.title: Billboard: ‚ÄòEddy Cue Believes the Future of Music Isn‚Äôt Lossless‚Äâ‚Äî‚ÄâIt‚Äôs Spatial Audio‚Äô

articles.description:
Jasmine Whitaker, writing for Adobe:
Today, we‚Äôre thrilled to announce that Illustrator and InDesign
will run natively on Apple Silicon devices. While users have been
able to continue to use the tool on M1 Macs during this period,
today‚Äôs development means a considerable boost in speed and
performance. Overall, Illustrator users will see a 65 percent
increase in performance on an M1 Mac, versus Intel builds‚Äâ‚Äî‚ÄâInDesign users will see similar gains, with a 59 percent
improvement on overall performance on Apple Silicon.
Specific things like opening complex documents and scrolling are even faster than those overall numbers: Adobe claims scrolling in Illustrator is 4√ó faster. Just from porting to run natively on Apple Silicon.
And we‚Äôve only seen Apple‚Äôs consumer Apple Silicon chips for Mac.

articles.description:
Speaking of playing the lottery, Philadelphia is getting in on the lottery-for-getting-vaccinated trend:
Philadelphia Mayor Jim Kenney announced today the launch of ‚ÄúPhilly Vax Sweepstakes,‚Äù a series of three citywide drawings designed to give Philadelphians extra motivation to get their vaccination against COVID-19 as the city fully reopens this summer.
A total of 36 vaccinated Philadelphians will win cash prizes up to $50,000, totaling nearly $400,000 in giveaways. In each of the three drawings on June 21, July 6, and July 19, six individuals will win $1,000; four will win $5,000; and two will win $50,000.
I really do love the idea of these lotteries and giveaway promotions. It‚Äôs innumeracy that leads some people to grossly miscalculate the risks vs. rewards of getting vaccinated, and it‚Äôs innumeracy that leads people to play lotteries. Sweepstakes for getting vaccinated put innumeracy to work.
¬†‚òÖ
articles.title: ‚ÄòPhilly Vax Sweepstakes‚Äô

A one-stop-shopping approach to mod downloading means creators lose some control of their work
 Nexus Mods is an A-list name among PC gamers, serving a McDonald‚Äôs-like 4.5 billion downloads of user-created content, changes, and improvements. The site is vital to a vibrant PC gaming culture whose players take pride in understanding how games are developed, and use that knowledge to tailor global bestselling franchises like The Witcher and The Elder Scrolls to their simplest taste. From the silly to the sublime, Nexus Mods has changed games for almost 20 years.
So it would seem to take a lot for that k‚Ä¶

articles.description:
Image: Bungie via Polygon
    

  
Eliksni Hatchling lets Guardians live their Destiny Sim dreams
 Destiny 2‚Äôs Fallen babies took the world by storm early this summer when the studio launched Season of the Splicer. The adorable refugees have been living in the Tower for some time, but thanks to a new emote, players can finally Rafiki their way into the lives of the four-eyed infants. 
Thanks to Destiny 2‚Äôs new Solstice of Heroes update, Guardians can finally get their hands on a Fallen baby of their own. The emote is called Eliksni Hatchling, and it‚Äôs exactly what you want. Players manifest a holographic Fallen baby into their hands and lift it into the sky, just like the opening of the Lion King when Rafiki shows Simba off to the Pride Lands.
Image: Bungie via Polygon
      The Eliksni baby blinks and gets very excited once you lift it
  
The emote‚Äôs name, Eliksni Hatchling, uses the term ‚ÄúEliksni‚Äù instead of ‚ÄúFallen.‚Äù In the world of Destiny, Eliksni is the proper name for the Fallen race, and what they choose to call themselves. The Eliksni Quarter ‚Äî where most of the Fallen babies are hanging out during Season of the Splicer ‚Äî uses the same term. The term Fallen has always been a ‚Äúnickname‚Äù for the ‚Äúevil‚Äù Eliksni, and the Eliksni that are currently in the Last City seem to view it as a pejorative term.
The Eliksni Hatchling emote will run players 1,000 Silver ‚Äî a common price for an Exotic emote. Players can purchase 1,100 Silver via Steam or other platform stores for $9.99. Today  In Destiny ‚Äî a website that can tell players when Eververse items will go on sale for the earnable Bright Dust currency ‚Äî doesn‚Äôt show the Eliksni Hatchling emote showing up for anything other than Silver for the rest of the season. However, the schedule does have some classified items on it, so the emote could show up for Bright Dust later on in the season.
articles.title: Destiny 2‚Äôs newest emote lets you lift a Fallen baby like Simba

articles.description:
Photo: Orion Pictures
    

  
Publisher Nacon pegs RoboCop: Rogue City for 2023 release
 A new RoboCop video game is in development and slated for release in 2023, publisher Nacon announced Tuesday during a livestream called Nacon Connect. Titled RoboCop: Rogue City, the first-person shooter will put players in the total body prosthesis of Alex Murphy, aka RoboCop, on a mission to protect Detroit.
Beyond that, Nacon and developer Teyon didn‚Äôt reveal much about RoboCop: Rogue City, other than that it‚Äôs destined for PC and unspecified consoles in a couple years. Rogue City will feature an original story in the franchise‚Äôs universe, Nacon said in a news release. The publisher and developer are working with studio MGM to ‚Äúdevelop an authentic RoboCop game experience that is faithful to the franchise‚Äôs DNA,‚Äù Nacon said.
Teyon certainly has experience bringing ‚Äô80s action heroes to video games. The Polish studio is perhaps best known for its work on Terminator: Resistance, the 2019 shooter based on the Terminator franchise that wasn‚Äôt the worst thing ever, and Rambo: The Video Game, a 2014 rail shooter that was, frankly, pretty awful. A teaser trailer for RoboCop: Rogue City hints at something similarly low budget and perhaps a bit janky, but still shows promise.
RoboCop‚Äôs had a rough go of it in the video game space. Outside of the movie-to-arcade adaptation created by Data East in 1988, Murphy‚Äôs mostly starred in mediocre console games and free-to-play mobile fare (and one Mortal Kombat game) over the past few decades. Here‚Äôs hoping that Nacon (formerly known as Bigben Interactive) and Teyon will turn things around for ol‚Äô Robo for his next adventure.
As for RoboCop‚Äôs next cinematic adventure, a planned direct sequel was in the works with director Neill Blomkamp, who left the project shortly after it was announced.
articles.title: RoboCop‚Äôs getting a new video game

How to level your armor up in 2021

Players begin with a ‚ÄúRenewed‚Äù armor set and get the task of leveling up to a ‚ÄúMajestic‚Äù armor set and eventually a ‚ÄúMagnificent‚Äù armor set. 
During this Solstice of Heroes, players can make their Magnificent armor glow without purchasing special items from the in-game Eververse store ‚Äî a white glow, just like last year. However, players who do purchase the Eververse glows will get Universal Ornaments ‚Äî meaning it‚Äôs a look players can apply to any armor piece ‚Äî that glows depending on their current subclass. This includes the new Stasis subclass from last year‚Äôs Beyond Light expansion.

Image: Giants Software
    

  
UFC 4, The Medium, and Tropico 6 are on the way, too
 Microsoft has announced six more games coming to Xbox Game Pass in July 2021: Dragon Quest Builders 2, Tropico 6, EA Sports UFC 4, Bloodroots, The Medium, and Farming Simulator 9. These game will roll out on different platforms across July.
Here‚Äôs the full breakdown from the Xbox Wire:
Dragon Quest Builders 2 (cloud) ‚Äî July 8
Tropico 6 (cloud, console, and PC) ‚Äî July 8
UFC 4 (console via EA Play) ‚Äî July 8
Bloodroots (cloud, console, and PC) ‚Äî July 15
Farming Simulator 19 (cloud, console, and PC) ‚Äî July 15
The Medium (cloud) ‚Äî July 15
Last month, Microsoft added a whole bunch of games, including Gang Beasts and Limbo. As always, games must leave Xbox Game Pass when new comes are welcomed. This month, EA Sports UFC and EA Sports UFC 2 will leave Xbox Game Pass via EA Play on July 14, while Endless Space, Downwell, and CrossCode will depart on July 15.
Xbox Game Pass is a subscription service from Microsoft ‚Äî and a dang good deal. There are plenty of games available for the subscription price, with more added every month. In June, Microsoft said it‚Äôll bring ‚Äúat least one new, first-party game into Game Pass‚Äù in each quarter of the year. Xbox Game Pass is $1 a month for the first three months; after that, it costs $9.99 a month on either PC or consoles, whereas the Ultimate tier, which includes both, goes for $14.99 per month.
Subscribers that have Xbox Game Pass Ultimate also have access to Microsoft‚Äôs Xbox Cloud Gaming platform, which is now available on Apple devices and Windows PC via browsers.
articles.title: Farming Simulator 19, Dragon Quest Builders 2 coming to Xbox Game Pass in July

Can a wireless gaming mouse be good for esports?
 I use to equate the quality of esports mice with garish looks, bulky construction, and fancy button configurations. However, my favorite mouse of the last few years, the Logitech G Pro Wireless, is the exact opposite of that aesthetic. It‚Äôs simple and understated. It feels so light, you would be excused for thinking it was just a regular office mouse. But the technology packed inside its tiny frame makes it fast, accurate, and effortless to use.
This is why we think that the Logitech G Pro Wireless one of the best esports and FPS gaming mice out there. 
Can you trust a wireless gaming mouse?
If you plan to play first-person shooters or esports titles seriously, then playing with a wireless mouse might seem‚Ä¶

articles.description:
Image: Finji
    


  
An artist and her friend hang on together through a panic attack
 Chicory can‚Äôt finish her work. She‚Äôs an artist, and an important one at that. She‚Äôs the wielder of the brush, a magical artifact that brings color into the black-and-white world of Picnic. But she doubts herself, her ability to paint creatively, and her worth as the brush wielder. Chicory starts to paint but erases her first strokes. She starts over again and again, never progressing as color naturally fades across the land and a looming darkness approaches. When she can‚Äôt stop what‚Äôs coming, the rabbit finally gives up. She abandons the brush and locks herself inside her room. 
This is where Chicory: A Colorful Tale begins. The player character, a dog that I named Oreo, is the first to find the magica‚Ä¶
articles.title: In Chicory, you fight the embodiment of self-destructive thoughts

articles.description:
Image: Bungie
    

  
Pick up three weapons and an armor pieces
 Trials of Osiris is back in Destiny 2. Saint-14 is the new Trials vendor and announcer, and players can find him and his wares in the Tower Hangar every Friday at reset.
Each week, the Trials of Osiris map changes, as do the rewards for winning a certain number of matches. The rewards are consistent across all players, although each player‚Äôs weapon roll will differ.
Here are the guaranteed Trials of Osiris rewards this week:
Map: The Dead Cliffs
3 wins ‚Äî The Messenger, Kinetic pulse rifle
5 wins ‚Äî Pyrrhic Ascent Grasps, Gauntlets, Gloves (Hunter, Titan, and Warlock gloves)
7 wins ‚Äî Shayura‚Äôs Wrath, Energy, submachine gun
Flawless ‚Äî Sola‚Äôs Scar (Adept), Kinetic pulse rifle ‚Äî random Adept mod
Note: As of Season of Arrivals, players can complete the End Game weekly bounty ‚Äî which just needs Trials match completions (wins give more progress) ‚Äî to earn the three-win reward.
Players who manage to reach seven wins without a single loss can go to the Lighthouse social space ‚Äî this is called a Flawless run. The Lighthouse offers additional rewards for players, some of which are unique, like a special emblem. Players who reach the Lighthouse also earn a special armor glow for any of their Trials of Osiris armor, which lasts for the remainder of the weekend.
articles.title: Destiny 2 Trials of Osiris rewards, July 2-6

articles.description:
Image: Midway Games/Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment
    

  
After two-plus years of support, MK11 is complete
 NetherRealm Studios, the company behind the Mortal Kombat series, is moving on to a new game ‚Äî and won‚Äôt be producing any more Mortal Kombat 11 content, the company announced Friday.
The studio is ‚Äúnow focusing on its next project‚Äù after supporting Mortal Kombat 11 for more than two years, it said in a tweet on the Mortal Kombat account. ‚ÄúDLC for the game, including characters, has come to an end,‚Äù NetherRealm said. 
NetherRealm is now focusing on its next project and after more than two years of supporting Mortal Kombat 11, DLC for the game, including characters, has come to an end.
‚Äî Mortal Kombat 11 Ultimate (@MortalKombat) July 2, 2021



Mortal Kombat 11 debuted in April 2019 on Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, Windows PC, and Xbox One. Over time, NetherRealm expanded upon the game with multiple DLC packs that added content such as stages and characters. The November 2020 release of Mortal Kombat 11 Ultimate, which collected all the DLC into one package, boasted a total of 13 additional fighters ‚Äî increasing the original roster by more than 50%. 
Discontinuing DLC means that there won‚Äôt be any major changes coming to the game. Fighting games like Mortal Kombat 11 often rely on consistent updates to help improve the experience by balancing characters and adding new ones. It‚Äôs a huge part of keeping fans interested, and invested in the game. 
NetherRealm did not provide any hints as to what the company‚Äôs next project will be.
articles.title: Mortal Kombat 11 DLC is done as NetherRealm shifts to next project

TFT Reckoning: Dawn of Heroes lets players choose a single, ultra-powerful Radiant item 
 Shadow Items will disappear in Teamfight Tactics: Reckoning‚Äôs mid-set update, Dawn of Heroes. In lieu of the Shadow Items that players have been using for the past few months, Dawn of Heroes will introduce a feature called Radiant Items, Riot announced in a blog post on Friday.
Shadow Items were powerful tools that also came with major drawbacks. By powering up one member, you might weaken others nearby, or something similar. Radiant Items do not have these drawbacks, and only offer powerful boons for players and their units. But unlike Shadow Items, players will only get one Radiant Item each game.

Vi from League of Legends stars in an animated video about relaxing
 Riot Games‚Äô latest music project is an album of chill lo-fi beats for players to relax/game to. The League of Legends and Valorant developer announced and released the new project on Friday, along with a YouTube animated video that spans the entire album and fits right in to the lo-fi genre. 
The album is called Sessions: Vi, named after the League of Legends champion that stars in the video and that the music is themed after.

Stratton said that remote work as a result of the pandemic slowed development of Invasion Mode. Other factors, including how already released updates for Doom Eternal resonated with players, influenced the decision to put Invasion Mode on the back burner.

 For college football fans wondering what the NCAA‚Äôs new policy on athlete endorsements means for a video game series, the answer is ‚Äî well, nothing specific yet. Image: Epic Games
    

  
The god of mischief is coming to Fortnite Crew
 Loki, the self-proclaimed god of mischief, will be bringing his tricks and pranks to Fortnite. Marvel‚Äôs anti-hero is the headliner for July 2021 Crew Pack, which features his iconic green outfit ‚Äî complete with cape and ‚Äúback bling‚Äù ‚Äî as well as his Scepter Pickaxe (‚Äúthe glow stick of destiny‚Äù), the Chitauri Chariot Glider, and a new welcoming loading screen. 
Loki‚Äôs bundle is available through Fortnite Crew, Fortnite‚Äôs monthly subscription offering. A Crew subscription costs $11.99 a month; that includes 1,000 free V-bucks, the current season‚Äôs battle pass ‚Äî which features Rick Sanchez from Rick and Morty this time around ‚Äî and whatever the current skin offering is each month.
Superhero cameos are nothing new in Fortnite. Thor, Iron Man, Wolverine, Storm, and others from the Marvel Comics universe showed up in the game last year, and of course, Thanos came to Fortnite back in 2018. Characters from the DC side of the superhero universes have also shown up; Batman entered Fortnite and got an entire miniseries, and Superman joined as a playable character as well. 
Loki‚Äôs Fortnite cameo comes on the heels of his big television series debut, which came to Disney Plus in June. That said, this Loki doesn‚Äôt seem to be based on Tom Hiddleston‚Äôs likeness; he looks a little slimmer, and a little more... shall we say, snakelike.
articles.title: Loki brings his shenanigans to Fortnite for the July Crew Pack

You can dance if you want to. Everyone did.
 Driving around the streets of San Andreas in Grand Theft Auto Online is usually done at 140 mph, outracing flying motorcycles, and listening to sweet tunes on the radio. But on a GTA Online role-playing server, life is much more tranquil. People (mostly) obey traffic laws and stop to smell the roses. They even hold parades. On the New Day role-play server, the GTA community even banded together for an in-game Pride event.
‚ÄúMyself as a player, I am a LGBT youth who is not as fortunate as others,‚Äù Peacheslatoure, the parade‚Äôs organizer, told Polygon over Discord. ‚ÄúI use roleplay as an outlet to express who I wish I could be to the public.‚Äù
On the New Day server, Peacheslatoure takes the role of Jeb Miller,‚Ä¶
articles.title: GTA Online role-players threw a massive in-game Pride parade

articles.description:
Image: Valve Software
    

  
Left 4 Dead 2 might still be the best game in the genre, even after all the new imitators 
 Nearly 12 years after the release of Left 4 Dead 2, the genre it popularized has crossed back into the spotlight. At E3 2021, and in the weeks after, studios and publishers have announced nearly half a dozen games inspired by Valve‚Äôs co-op shooter. But even after a decade of innovations that other developers could bring to the genre, its best version might still be Left 4 Dead 2 with a few minor upgrades. 
When Left 4 Dead 2 was first released, many fans bristled at the fact that it was coming just a year after the original game. Sure, it had new levels, the addition of melee weapons, better enemy AI, and more enemy types, but at a glance, it didn‚Äôt look much different‚Ä¶
articles.title: Left 4 Dead doesn‚Äôt need spiritual successors, it needs updates

articles.description:
Image: BioWare/Electronic Arts
    

  
Hey! You got your Agent in my Bounty Hunter!
 Star Wars: The Old Republic is turning ten, and a new expansion to the story-based MMO is on the way. On Thursday, BioWare announced a new expansion called Legacy of the Sith, which comes with tons of story and mechanical upgrades to the game. 
Players get to hunt down the renegade Sith Darth Malgus on the aquatic planet of Manaan. Malgus has been a threat in the game since the very beginning, and the conflict with him has been building throughout various quests and campaigns.
After Star Wars: The Old Republic‚Äôs launch in 2011, the story took a diversion into exploring a third faction, the Eternal Empire. More recent expansions have returned The Old Republic to the very familiar battleground of Empire versus Republic, and the conflict will continue as the sides battle over Manaan.


Legacy of the Sith will raise the level cap by 5, up to 80, and will also introduce a new Flash Point and Operations for players to tackle together. In addition, players can expect some big improvements to day-to-day play style. The character customization, class design, and itemization is all being streamlined and improved.
The most interesting addition is Combat Styles, which means ‚Äúindependently choosing a specific class story and combining it with ability sets from other related tech or Force-wielding classes.‚Äù In short, it‚Äôs less about picking one class and being restrained to specific abilities, and more about going with a tech or Force character, then mixing and matching components to build a playing style you enjoy.
Legacy of the Sith will arrive during the holiday season in 2021, and kick off The Old Republic‚Äôs 10th anniversary event, which runs throughout 2022.
articles.title: Star Wars: The Old Republic‚Äôs next expansion is all about mixing things up

articles.description:
EA Play 2019, outside the Hollywood Palladium in L.A. | Photo by Christian Petersen/Getty Images
    

  
Streams start July 8, EA Play Live gets underway July 22
 Electronic Arts‚Äô midsummer showcase, EA Play Live, begins July 22, and it will be preceded by a livestream series called EA Play Spotlight, running from July 8 to July 20, the company announced Thursday. 
EA Sports figures prominently in the broadcast schedule, with shows on Monday, July 19, and Tuesday, July 20. Madden NFL 22 takes the Monday slot with a discussion of ‚ÄúHow the Community Shaping Madden NFL 22.‚Äù The newest version of the game, launching at the end of August, will feature several improvements and systems changes in its Franchise mode, directly answering criticisms and requests from longtime players.
July 20‚Äôs broadcast is simply ‚ÄúMore EA SPORTS!‚Äù according to Thursday‚Äôs announcement from Electronic Arts. The July 8 show is about ‚ÄúThe Future of First-Person Shooters,‚Äù which likely includes a discussion of Battlefield 2042, announced three weeks ago as E3 2021 was getting underway.
And July 13‚Äôs showcase is focused to the EA Originals label, which publishes independent studios‚Äô games, such as May‚Äôs Knockout City from Velan Studios, or Coldwood Interactive‚Äôs Unravel and Unravel Two.
Image: Electronic Arts
  
All broadcasts, except for July 19‚Äôs, begin at 1 p.m. EDT/10 a.m. PDT. The Madden livestream is set for 7 p.m EDT/4 p.m. PDT.
EA Play Live begins at 1 p.m. EDT/10 a.m. PDT on July 22; a news release from EA said that the main show will be 40 minutes long and spotlight Battlefield 2042, Apex Legends, and Lost in Random, an EA Originals title from Zoink Games, which also made 2018‚Äôs Fe for Electronic Arts. Lost in Random was announced during E3 2019.
articles.title: EA talking Battlefield, Madden, and more in pre-EA Play Live livestreams

articles.description:
Image: Bungie via Polygon
    

  
Quria deserved more after 6 years
 Bungie concluded one of the major plots in Destiny 2: Season of the Splicer on Tuesday. Players dived into the Vex Network and killed Quria, one of Savathun‚Äôs most important pawns and the force behind the Endless Night in the Tower. 
Over the past year, Bungie has started intertwining Destiny 2‚Äôs gameplay and story, giving players a reason to care about upcoming events and plot twists. So the appearance of a major pawn like Quria ups the stakes. But Bungie‚Äôs story improvements reveal a new problem: The gameplay doesn‚Äôt live up to the story‚Äôs expectations.
Quria has been a known villain for years, but instead of going out in a major piece of content like a raid or dungeon, the mission to kill her is a remix of several Sea‚Ä¶
articles.title: Destiny 2‚Äôs story is finally great, but the game hasn‚Äôt caught up

articles.description:
Image: Blizzard Entertainment
    

  
[peasant voice] Off I go then
 The last Hearthstone expansion, Forged in the Barrens, took us to a predominantly Horde zone to see how Kalimdor was faring. The follow-up expansion, United in Stormwind, was revealed today, and it looks the Alliance equivalent. The expansion has 135 new cards and some new mechanics that should add an intriguing twist to the digital card game.
As always, there‚Äôs a new keyword with this expansion, and it‚Äôs Tradable. Tradable cards can be played normally, or you can put them back into your deck for one mana and draw another card that might work better. Of course, it might not; it‚Äôs a bit of a gamble. 
Players will also be able to get new Mount spells. Mounts buff up minions, and if the rider dies, the enemy still has to co‚Ä¶
articles.title: Hearthstone‚Äôs next expansion takes us back to the spires of Stormwind

articles.description:
Image: Rare/Xbox Game Studios
    

  
We shan‚Äôt spoil who or what it concerns; read on if ye dare
 There‚Äôs a hell of an Easter egg crossover awaiting Sea of Thieves players at the end of the new expansion, A Pirate‚Äôs Life, which launched on June 22. In fact, it‚Äôs so good, pretty much even the slyest mention of its adjacent connection to A Pirate‚Äôs Life ‚Äî a crossover with Disney‚Äôs Pirates of the Caribbean franchise ‚Äî would probably give it away. Therefore:
[Warning: The remainder of this post will spoil the surprise at the end of Sea of Thieves: A Pirate‚Äôs Life.]
At the end of A Pirate‚Äôs Life, players explore a shipwreck. Nothing per se unusual there. But as you approach the rotting hulk of splintered masts and tattered sails ‚Ä¶ well, up the music, as they say:
Avast! Here be a pull quote i‚Ä¶
articles.title: Sea of Thieves: A Pirate‚Äôs Life Easter egg is a treasure chest of fan service

articles.description:
Image: Bungie
    

  
The European Aerial Zone is back in Destiny 2
 Solstice of Heroes, Destiny 2‚Äôs summer celebration event, will return this year on July 6. Bungie announced the holiday‚Äôs return in a post on its website. The event will run until Aug. 3, and players will be able to earn some new goodies to celebrate summer in the Last City. This comes after after the final Season of the Splicer mission, which Bungie launched on June 29. It‚Äôs notable that, in the screenshot above, the Tower is shown in the day time, whereas it has been mired in darkness since early May.
As usual, the Solstice of Heroes event revolves around acquiring and upgrading special armor sets. Players will get low-ranking armor at the start of the event and slowly improve it by performing various tasks throughout ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Destiny 2‚Äôs Solstice of Heroes event adds new armor and a shotgun

articles.description:
Image: Digital Extremes
    

  
And I am here for it
 Warframe‚Äôs story has recently brought a new antagonist to the forefront, and it looks like he‚Äôs getting some backup. The game‚Äôs next update, Sisters of Parvos, will arrive on July 6 and it brings a major new Corpus adversary for players to fight in exchange for sweet weapons.
Parvos Granum is the founder of the Corpus, and he‚Äôs returned from being in space limbo to lead the faction. That‚Äôs where the title ‚ÄúSisters of Parvos‚Äù comes from ‚Äî he went ahead and made some really powerful bodyguard ladies, and now they want to kill us. These assassins are the Corpus equivalent to the Grineer‚Äôs Kuva Liches, and players will have to undergo multiple encounters to either permanently kill them or add them as an ally to their crew.
  Command the oc‚Ä¶
articles.title: Warframe‚Äôs new nemesis will crush your head between her thighs

articles.description:
Image: Square Enix
    

  
Square Enix‚Äôs new collection brings updated graphics and music
 Square Enix has announced a release date for three games in its upcoming remaster anthology of the first six Final Fantasy games. The Final Fantasy Pixel Remaster versions of Final Fantasy, Final Fantasy 2 and Final Fantasy 3, will launch July 28 for Android, iOS, and Windows PC via Steam. 
The next three games, Final Fantasy 4 through 6, have TBA 2021 launch dates for now. Square Enix first announced plans for the Pixel Remaster anthology at its E3 2021 news conference in June. 
All remasters will feature updated 2D pixel graphics, a soundtrack overseen by the series‚Äô longtime composer, Nobuo Uematsu, a new user interface, and content bonuses like a bestiary, illustration gallery, and music player. 


The Steam page for the Pixel Remaster version of Final Fantasy says the game is based on the original Final Fantasy that launched in 1987, but its ‚Äúfeatures and/or content may differ from previously rereleased versions of the game.‚Äù The page did not list any system requirements for the games. 
The full Final Fantasy Pixel Remaster bundle is also available for pre-order and is priced at $95.94. Individual games are priced between $11.99 and $17.99.
articles.title: Final Fantasy Pixel Remaster‚Äôs first three games come to PC and mobile in July

articles.description:
Image: Shedworks/Raw Fury via YouTube
    

  
How the developers learned from the popular Zelda game
 Link‚Äôs jump is heavy. And when the hero hops off the side of a cliff, he‚Äôs got only a simple cloth glider to catch his fall. Gravity makes the gliding in The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild feel vulnerable, but the design still captures the tranquility of floating through the air. The balance between peace and unease makes Link‚Äôs travel feel real and important. 
In Sable, the new third-person adventure game by Shedworks, that sort of climbing and gliding is an even more essential part of the gameplay. If I jump off one of Sable‚Äôs rocky desert cliffs as the game‚Äôs titular hero, I‚Äôm embraced by a warm, orangish red bubble that feels safer than Breath of the Wild, but evokes the same fee‚Ä¶
articles.title: Sable was inspired by Breath of the Wild, but its gliding might be better

articles.description:
Image: Blizzard Entertainment
    


  
Development update from Diablo‚Äôs art team shows off the Blood Bishop, Succubus, and more
 Blizzard Entertainment‚Äôs next Diablo may still be a long way off, but a new look at the game‚Äôs  artwork, ranging from character classes, to new and reimagined monsters, to smaller details like armor dyes, shows how Diablo 4 is progressing. In a blog post published Wednesday, Diablo 4 art director John Mueller, lead character artist Arnaud Kotelnikoff, and associate art director Nick Chilano offered new insights into the dark fantasy world of Blizzard‚Äôs sequel.
Speaking with Mueller over Zoom, the art director told Polygon that the content on display is ‚Äúpretty polished‚Äù and ‚Äúa good representation of where we‚Äôre at today‚Äù with Diablo 4‚Äôs development.
Some of the ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Blizzard gives us a new look at Diablo 4‚Äôs classes and classic enemies

articles.description:
Image: Infinity Ward/Activision
    

  
The C58 and Nail Gun both got a nerf
 Call of Duty: Warzone is just a few weeks into season 4, so there are still a few balance tweaks to be made to the new weapons. In the latest Warzone patch, Raven Software is bringing nerfs to the C58 assault rifle and the Nail Gun.
After its addition with season 4, the C58 quickly proved to be one of Warzone‚Äôs strongest assault rifles, so it makes sense that Raven is trying to pull back some of that power. In the new patch, the weapon has slightly higher recoil, making its fire a little harder to control. Raven Software also applied a similar recoil nerf to the FARA 83, a weapon that‚Äôs been one of Warzone‚Äôs strongest for quite a while now. 
The Nail Gun also got a nerf in this patch. According to Raven, the Nai‚Ä¶
articles.title: Call of Duty: Warzone‚Äôs latest patch nerfs its overpowered new weapons

articles.description:
Image: id Software/Bethesda Softworks
    

  
Top-of-the-line consoles get three graphical modes; everyone gets two new levels
 Doom Eternal‚Äôs free upgrade for the newest consoles, which packs three new graphics modes (two for the Xbox Series S), is now available for those who have the original game. We‚Äôll point out that Doom Eternal is on the buffet of Bethesda Softworks titles that joined Xbox Game Pass in the spring, so this upgrade covers a lot more than the folks who bought it outright in March 2020.
Update 6 also brings new content to all versions of the game. Taras Nabad is a new Master Level challenge, taking players to ‚Äúthe capital of Argent D‚ÄôNur,‚Äù according to the patch notes. There‚Äôs also a new 2v1 Battlemode arena, Corrosion, to go with improvements to Battlemode, including balance changes and bandwidth optimizations. All players also get a chromed-out Ray Tracer Ballista weapon skin to show off the new hardware‚Äôs capability.


For the upgraded version, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, and Xbox Series S all get Performance and Balanced graphical modes, HDR 10 support in any graphics mode, ‚ÄúUltra-Quality Style Graphics Settings,‚Äù and cross-generation Battlemode support with their console‚Äôs predecessor (PS4 or Xbox One). Xbox Series X and PlayStation 5 get an additional Ray Tracing Mode running at 1800p resolution and 60 frames per second.
Doom Eternal on PlayStation 5 adds support for the DualSense‚Äôs adaptive triggers; Xbox Series X and Series S both have variable refresh rates and variable rate shadings.
As for the graphical modes: Balanced Mode on PS5 and Series X offers 4K resolution and 60 fps; on Series S, it‚Äôs 1440p and 60 fps. Performance Mode for Series X is 1800p and 120 fps; for PlayStation 5, it‚Äôs 1584p and 120 fps. For Series S, it‚Äôs 1080p, 120 frames per second.
As far as the Windows PC version of Doom Eternal, Bethesda says only that the Ray Tracing Mode is available dependent on hardware.
articles.title: Doom Eternal‚Äôs PS5 and Xbox Series X free upgrade available now

articles.description:
Image:¬†Johan Peitz¬†via Polygon
    

  
Now, this is¬†podracing!
 Luckily for us, developers are constantly documenting highlights from the game-making process with the hashtag #ScreenshotSaturday. These posts ‚Äî which can come in the form of GIFs, screenshots, and video clips ‚Äî  allow fans to feast on the characters and worlds long before the release of the games. So we‚Äôve rounded up some of the coolest works-in-progress we saw thanks to #ScreenshotSaturday to give you a sneak peek into all the fun stuff that excites us. 
This week‚Äôs list includes a chunky and pixelated podracing game inspired by Star Wars: The Phantom Menace. Another post also showed off the early stages of a fan-made 3D version of Earthbound. 
As for completely original concepts, animal-inspired games continue to be a pop‚Ä¶
articles.title: Star Wars podracing looks even cooler as pixel art

articles.description:
Image: Blizzard Entertainment
    

  
Lots to do and old friends to see
 World of Warcraft: Shadowlands has been in its launch phase for months, as Tuesday‚Äôs 9.1 patch is the first piece of content created entirely under Blizzard Entertainment‚Äôs work-from-home protocols. Chains of Dominations changes up the current anima grind and Covenant quests by introducing a smorgasbord of new content for players who are focused on the endgame.
First ‚Äî and most prominent ‚Äî is the new zone of Korthia, the City of Secrets. Korthia is the next frontier of the Maw, and the Covenants are showing up to fight back against the Jailer. There are two new reputations and a ton of mounts to collect in the area, as well as new gear and quests. If you‚Äôre looking for a new horsie or bat to ride, this patch is a pre‚Ä¶
articles.title: World of Warcraft‚Äôs new patch is a buffet of collectibles and cameos

articles.description:
The developer is inviting you back to the oldest house, and it wants you to bring your friends
 Control, a video game full of strange things that no one can really explain, is getting a spinoff that is aptly inexplicable: a multiplayer game. 
Dubbed Project Condor by developer Remedy Entertainment, the game will be a 4-player player-vs-environment (PvE) co-op game set in the world of Control. Besides that very Left 4 Dead-sounding genre descriptor, details are scant. A blog post from Mikael Kasurinen, game director of the Control franchise, emphasizes the ‚Äúworld‚Äù part, noting that Control protagonist Jesse Faden‚Äôs journey into the Oldest House was just a small part of that world and that Condor is an expression of how much bigger it can be. Kasurinen also shared this bit of concept art, which Kasurinen claims ‚Äútells pretty well what Condor is about.‚Äù
Image: Remedy Entertainment
  
That may be a joke.
Also tucked away in the Condor announcement was an agreement with 505 games to publish a ‚Äúa bigger-budget Control-game, to be agreed in more detail in the future,‚Äù which is the first official statement from Remedy about a Control sequel. All we know now is that it will be more expensive, which makes sense, as dealing with sentient buildings and extradimensional entities tends to have a way of running up a tab.
articles.title: Control is getting a multiplayer spinoff and sequel

articles.description:
Image: Cryptic Studios/Perfect World
    

  
The game won‚Äôt come to Windows PC via Steam or console, after all
 Magic: Legends, Cryptic Studios‚Äô Magic: The Gathering video game adaptation, will go offline on Oct. 31, the studio announced Tuesday. The servers will go offline at 11:59 p.m. PST on that date, just months after Magic: Legends was released into open beta.
Magic: Legends was scheduled for a full release later in 2021 on Windows PC via Steam, as well as on PlayStation 4 and Xbox One. Cryptic Studios said the game will not be released, and that the studio has ‚Äúno plans‚Äù to revive the game in the future. Magic: Legends executive producer Stephen Ricossa said in the announcement that the ‚Äúvision for Magic: Legends missed the mark,‚Äù but provided no further explanation for the shutdow‚Ä¶
articles.title: Magic: Legends will shut down in October, before game‚Äôs full release

articles.description:
Image: Blizzard Entertainment
    

  
A legendary bow! A mount! And more!
 Today‚Äôs World of Warcraft patch is a big one. Chains of Domination, also known as patch 9.1, brings a new raid, zone, new end-game systems, and 40 new mounts. The final boss of that raid is Sylvanas Windrunner, and fans have been waiting to beat her ass for a long time now. If you‚Äôre still on her side, Blizzard has made her one of the juiciest loot pinatas in the game for years to come ‚Äî she has a legendary bow, unique weapons, and a mount.
Sylvanas has been the antagonist throughout Battle for Azeroth and Shadowlands, and if you‚Äôve been playing since the old days of the game, you may have a grudge against her for her actions in 2010‚Äôs Cataclysm expansion. She‚Äôs spent the last eleven years just being the absolute w‚Ä¶
articles.title: Warcraft‚Äôs most infamous elf is the game‚Äôs newest loot pinata

articles.description:
Image: Acid Nerve/Devolver Digital
    

  
Crow mercy
 The machinery of death works much like an office, with people hoping for big upcoming quarters and complaining about paperwork. The world of death is black, white, and weirdly relatable. Early on, I lose a soul I was sent to reap, which is a pretty big deal back at HQ. My crow is sent back out into the mortal world, which is colorful, overgrown, and full of monsters. 
In Death‚Äôs Door, I‚Äôm an adorable little bird with a sword, a bow, and a mission to collect as many souls as possible. It‚Äôs not easy being a little crow up against enormous beasts, but it‚Äôs a living. If I die in the mortal world, I‚Äôm sent back to the start ‚Äî but I get to keep all the goodies I found along the way, making each run a little easier.
I travel with a top-down ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Soul reaping is just a job in Death‚Äôs Door, but some crow‚Äôs gotta do it

articles.description:
Image: Milestone/Mattel
    

  
Well-balanced arcade-racing action with a distinctive Hot Wheels style
 I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve thought about Mattel‚Äôs Hot Wheels in decades, but I‚Äôll be circling Sept. 30 this year. Hot Wheels Unleashed launches that day, and the arcade-style racer couldn‚Äôt be in better hands. 
Milan-based Milestone, known for hardcore, licensed racing simulations like Monster Energy Supercross 4 and the MotoGP franchise, gets an opportunity to stretch its legs creatively with the die-cast collectible cars, and they do not waste the moment one bit. A weekend with a preview build of Hot Wheels Unleashed showed me thrilling, well-balanced racing action, again and again and again. It‚Äôs not simply a roll-out of kart-racing tropes and power-ups in a Hot Wheels chassis. There‚Äôs enoug‚Ä¶
articles.title: Hot Wheels Unleashed delivers the orange-track fantasy in a surprisingly good racer

articles.description:
Image: Square Enix
    

  
Stranger of Paradise‚Äôs Soul Shield changed my mind about the entire game
 Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origins rocketed into this world on fire. Square Enix‚Äôs chaos-filled E3 trailer instantly became a meme, and the accompanying demo launched in an unplayable state. Worse, the gameplay just looked dull.
But after actually playing the Stranger of Paradise demo, I‚Äôve flipped my opinion. In fact, it only took one novel idea to elevate this Final Fantasy punchline to one of my most anticipated releases for 2022: the Soul Shield.
What is the Soul Shield?
Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origins plays like a Soulsborne game, which developer Team Ninja has plenty of experience with in Nioh. As Jack, you battle enemies in punishing, deliberate combat, barely m‚Ä¶
articles.title: Forget Final Fantasy guy‚Äôs T-shirt and focus on his incredible shield

articles.description:
Image: Microsoft
    

  
Available via browsers for Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscribers
 Microsoft has fully opened up its Xbox Cloud Gaming platform to Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscribers on Apple iOS devices and Windows PCs via browsers, the company announced Monday. Xbox Cloud Gaming, also known as xCloud, was previously available only to Android device users, though an invite-only beta period opened this year for certain Apple and Windows 10 users.
Now, any Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscriber can access the service through the Xbox website via www.xbox.com/play. From there, players can access a selection of games directly in their browser, with some options available between controller or touch-based play. With this announcement, Microsoft also said it‚Äôs improved the cloud gaming exper‚Ä¶
articles.title: Xbox Cloud Gaming now available on Apple devices

articles.description:
Image: Bethesda Game Studios/Bethesda Softworks
    

  
Designer‚Äôs German shepherd guided famed sidekick‚Äôs behavior and personality
 Fallout 4‚Äôs real-life Dogmeat ‚Äî a German Shepherd named River, in the care of designer Joel Burgess ‚Äî has passed away. By all accounts, she was a good girl.
‚ÄúWhat we wanted was a companion first, and a combat ally second,‚Äù Burgess wrote ‚Äî of Dogmeat ‚Äî on Twitter on Sunday. In a thread memorializing River, he recalled that he stopped over to the desk of a new developer on the Fallout 4 team, one tasked with building the Dogmeat character, and ‚ÄúResearch covered the walls; countless images of German Shepherds snarling, all teeth and attack postures.‚Äù
‚ÄúWithin a day or two, River started visiting the studio,‚Äù Burgess wrote.
I said goodbye today to River, who most‚Ä¶
articles.title: Rest in peace, River: Fallout 4‚Äôs Dogmeat and a companion to millions

articles.description:
Image: Crystal Dynamics/Square Enix
    

  
The Tachyon Anomaly Event is about to be full time
 Four Hulks or four Iron Mans are about to be the new normal in Marvel‚Äôs Avengers, Square Enix and Crystal Dynamics announced last week. The Tachyon Anomaly Event, which allowed Marvel‚Äôs Avengers players to play as multiple versions of the same heroes while grouped up, is about to become a permanent feature in the game. The studios revealed an update to the game‚Äôs pre-War for Wakanda expansion roadmap, which includes duplicate heroes permanently, the game‚Äôs first ‚ÄúOmega Level Threat,‚Äù and multiplayer Mega Hives. 
In April, Crystal Dynamics hosted the Tachyon Anomaly Event, which allowed players to play as multiples of the same hero in the same party ‚Äî outside of the event, players are only allow‚Ä¶
articles.title: Marvel‚Äôs Avengers will soon let you play as multiples of the same hero, permanently

articles.description:
Box art for Ultima Underworld 1+2, a 2011 re-release of the 1992 and 1993 games. | Image: Blue Sky Productions, Origin Systems/Electronic Arts
    

  
Ultima Underworld 1+2, Syndicate Plus, and Syndicate Wars all leaving; all but Syndicate Wars are on Origin
 Three 1990s games from Electronic Arts‚Äô Origin Systems PC line will be delisted from GOG.com on Monday, June 28. The titles are Ultima Underworld 1+2, Syndicate Wars, and Syndicate Plus, the 1996 re-release that comprises the first Syndicate and its expansion.
All three are currently available for $1.49 each. Anyone who buys the games before their delisting will still find them in their GOG.com library of titles after they‚Äôre taken down. They may still re-download them, too. The removal takes effect at 9 a.m. EDT on June 28.
GOG.com noted in a forum post Thursday that it was pulling the games on request from the publisher. Polygon has reached out to an Electronic Arts representative for additional comment. All of the games involved, except for Syndicate Wars, are currently available through EA‚Äôs Origin storefront.
Syndicate, by Peter Molyneux‚Äôs Bullfrog Productions, launched in 1993, with an expansion pack released later that year. It was followed by Syndicate Wars in 1996. The isometric real-time strategy and tactics game was rebooted in 2012 as a first-person shooter.
Ultima Underworld: The Stygian Abyss and Ultima Underworld 2: Labyrinth of Worlds launched in 1992 and 1993, respectively. Richard Garriott directed and Warren Spector produced the first game; Spector produced and Paul Neurath directed the second. The two were packaged together for sale on GOG.com in 2011.
articles.title: Four PC classics delisted from GOG.com next week

articles.description:
Image: Greg Lobanov,¬†Alexis Dean-Jones,¬†Madeline Berger,¬†Em Halberstadt, Lena Raine/Finji
    


  
Don‚Äôt sleep on this clear GOTY contender
 One of Chicory: A Colorful Tale‚Äôs most pivotal scenes begins with a dark room. Eyes track and trace across the otherwise black screen, the crude drawings of neon eyes lighting up the space. My character, a dog I named Pancake, must face the inverted version of itself in a split-screen fight. 
In taking on the weight of a magical paintbrush‚Äôs legacy, Pancake must contend with a devastating corruption in self-doubt and personal worth, which comes to a head in this particular moment. 
It‚Äôs the literal interpretation of a sort of internal battle that‚Äôs familiar to so many people, the light taking on the dark and spun into a luminous, centerpiece battle t‚Ä¶
articles.title: A coloring book come to life, Chicory: A Colorful Tale is a must-play

articles.description:
Image: Bungie
    

  
Loot incentives return for legacy expansions
 Destiny 2‚Äôs next update, on July 6, will reissue the remaining 12 legendary weapons from the Forsaken and Shadowkeep expansions, rounding out a promise made earlier this year to return about two dozen weapon and armor sets from their earlier sunsetting.
Nine of the returning weapons can be found on the Moon: Loud Lullaby, One Small Step, Tranquility, Arc Logic, Dream Breaker, Every Waking Moment, Love and Death, A Fine Memorial, and Night Terror. Three more are found in The Dreaming City: Tigerspite, Twilight Oath, and Abide the Return.
‚ÄúWe know that several of these weapons have been popular in the past, looking at you Twilight Oath,‚Äù Bungie wrote in a weekly update on Thursday, ‚Äúand we hope you enjoy getting fresh drops.‚Äù
In January, Bungie announced it would walk back some of the weapon sunsetting plans it made in 2020 for Destiny 2. Season 13, which began in February, reissued eight weapons and two armor sets, found in the Dreaming City and Moon locations as well. 
‚ÄúWe are making these changes to help preserve the relevancy of the destinations, specifically some of the pinnacle end-game activities that still exist there,‚Äù Bungie said in January. That followed players‚Äô disappointment in the infusion-capping system introduced in Destiny 2: Beyond Light, which removed the loot incentive to play through the Forsaken and Shadowkeep expansions.
articles.title: More Forsaken and Shadowkeep weapons return in Destiny 2‚Äôs next update

articles.description:
Image: Mojang/Microsoft
    

  
Here comes trouble! 
 Do you know axolotls, those salamander-like creatures that live in the water and sometimes have no eyes? They‚Äôre in Minecraft now, and the blocky little creatures have set fan communities ablaze with their adorableness.
The creatures were part of the Caves and Cliffs update launched on the Bedrock version of Minecraft on June 8. The update was a hefty one ‚Äî it brought news blocks, powder snow, and glowing lichen. However, it seems that all the other improvements pale in comparison to the newly added axolotls.
The glittering image of prime evolution, axolotls are amphibians identifiable by their unique external gills that look like feathery appendages on their heads. The Minecraft ones come in all sorts of colors, with some shades and c‚Ä¶
articles.title: Axolotls are the real star of the latest Minecraft update

articles.description:
Image: Sega
    

  
Gotta go fast (and get it before July 1)
 Sonic Mania is currently free on the Epic Games Store, and will be available for fans to snag until July 1. The promotion is tied-in with Sonic‚Äôs 30th anniversary, which is a pretty impressive run.
Sonic Mania is unique in that it‚Äôs a fan-made project that was published by Sega, and the game was well-received. Sonic Mania goes back to the style of the original Genesis platformers without just being a rehash; the game added new mechanics and some impressive level design the original formula. 
It‚Äôs a bit of a golden era for Sonic fans. The film Sonic the Hedgehog 2 is currently in development, and it looks like it‚Äôs more focused on Sonic and his world than the real world city of Green Hills. On July 23, the Prague Philarmonic Orchestra performed a symphony concert that included the full range of the Sonic‚Äôs series‚Äô jams. Sonic Mania helped usher in a new era for the cool blue hedgehog, so it‚Äôs nice to see more people getting a chance to check it out.
articles.title: Celebrate Sonic‚Äôs birthday with a free copy of Sonic Mania from Epic

articles.description:
Image: Bungie
    

  
A mysterious emblem sale started a major debate over the weekend
 Last weekend, Destiny fans erupted in an argument over data-mining and spoilers. What started as the sale of a mysterious emblem quickly turned into players turning on some of the community‚Äôs most valuable members: data miners.
Images of a mysterious new emblem called ‚ÄúA Classy Order‚Äù started circling around Twitter over the weekend. Destiny community manager Dylan ‚Äúdmg04‚Äù Gafner publicly reached out to ‚ÄúTryhard ‚ÄòTrials Player‚Äô Tristan,‚Äù a user sporting the new emblem, to ask how they acquired it. Minutes later, Gafner tweeted a warning to players that started the weekend‚Äôs debate.
‚ÄúDon‚Äôt buy the Spicy Ramen Coupon emblem,‚Äù Gafner said about the A Classy Order emblem. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs meant to be a free gift on B‚Ä¶
articles.title: Destiny¬†players and Bungie are currently at war over spoiler culture

articles.description:
Image: Maxis/Electronic Arts
    

  
And yes, the songs are all in Simlish
 The Sims 4 players will get a new stage to explore this summer, with an in-game musical event called Sims Sessions. Sims Sessions will run from June 26 through July 7, and includes artists like Bebe Rexha, Glass Animals lead singer Dave Bayley, and singer and songwriter Joy Oladokun.
The Sims franchise has a long history of collaborating with artists to bring their music into the game. Notably, every song has to be changed, because in the Sims everyone speaks Simlish ‚Äî even the celebrity cameos. While songs are often used for promotional purposes, Sims Sessions will have them be integrated into the game world.
Players can dress their Sims up, head down to the concert, and pick up exclusive digital merchandise from the performers. Once the show is done, they can take to the stage themselves to play some sick tunes. Or, if you‚Äôre not interested in that much attention, Sims can sneak off to WooHoo in the tents.
There‚Äôs even a tie-in TikTok challenge called #SimlishSessions, where players can sing the single Sabotage in Simlish. It‚Äôs a good time to learn the difference between ‚Äúyabahorne‚Äù and ‚Äúyim bala.‚Äù
The Sims 4 will be on sale leading up to Sims Sessions from June 24-29. Players don‚Äôt need any expansions in order to visit the Sims Sessions event in-game.
articles.title: The Sims 4 is getting in-game music festivals with good vibes

articles.description:
Image: Bit Fry Game Studios
    

  
Apple Arcade‚Äôs sports ensemble lets Megan Rapinoe dunk on Wayne Gretzky
 Ben Freidlin knows what folks are looking at first when they see a screenshot of Ultimate Rivals: The Court. It‚Äôs usually the licensing. The celebrities. They‚Äôre gazing at Alex Morgan from the U.S. Women‚Äôs National Team, soaring high over Hall-of-Famer Wayne Gretzky. Neither one plays basketball, but she‚Äôs about to jam one in the Great One‚Äôs face.
Freidlin, chief executive of Bit Fry Game Studios, doesn‚Äôt deny that inking 60 all-stars from five sports to a licensing deal for a mobile video game is a hell of a head-turner. (The late David Stern, the former NBA commissioner and an investor in Bit Fry, told Sports Business Journal that anyone who could pull together that many leagues ‚Ä¶
articles.title: What if NBA Jam were a fighting game? It‚Äôd be Ultimate Rivals

articles.description:
Image: Microsoft
    

  
PC gaming features also include auto HDR, DirectStorage API
 Windows 11, the next version of Microsoft‚Äôs operating system, will offer a number of features targeted toward PC gamers, led by Xbox Game Pass directly within Windows‚Äô new Xbox app, Microsoft announced Thursday during its Windows 11 reveal event.
Presenting Windows 11 as ‚Äúthe best Windows ever for gaming,‚Äù Sarah Bond, Xbox corporate vice president for game creator experience and ecosystem, appeared on Microsoft‚Äôs livestream to announce that Xbox Game Pass will be ‚Äúbuilt right into Windows 11.‚Äù Microsoft has been testing this functionality for many months with a redesigned Xbox app for Windows 10, but clips of the Windows 11 version that Bond showed seemed to indicate a deeper integration.
The Xbox app wi‚Ä¶

articles.description:
Image: CyberConnect2/Sega
    

  
Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba - The Hinokami Chronicles arrives in October
 The Demon Slayer video game, Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba - The Hinokami Chronicles, is coming to North America and Europe this October, thanks to publisher Sega. Developed by CyberConnect2, the video game based on the popular Demon Slayer anime will be released on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Windows PC (via Steam), Xbox One, and Xbox Series X.
CyberConnect2 is best known for its work on anime-inspired fare like Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot and the Naruto: Ultimate Ninja and .hack games. The studio‚Äôs take on Demon Slayer looks on par with its brand of cel-shaded arena-based fighting and interactive storytelling. The Hinokami Chronicles will retell the Tanjiro Kamado, Unwavering Resolve Arc and Mugen Train Arc from Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba.
Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba - The Hinokami Chronicles will feature voice work from the original English- and Japanese-language cast. Here‚Äôs the game‚Äôs official description:
It is the Taisho Period in Japan. Tanjiro, a kindhearted boy who sells charcoal for a living, finds his family slaughtered by a demon. To make matters worse, his younger sister Nezuko, the sole survivor, has been transformed into a demon herself. Though devastated by this grim reality, Tanjiro resolves to become a ‚Äúdemon slayer‚Äù so that he can turn his sister back into a human and kill the demon that massacred his family.

Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba - The Hinokami Chronicles will arrive Oct. 15.
articles.title: The Demon Slayer video game heads West, thanks to Sega

articles.description:
Destiny 2 | Image: Bungie
    

  
Despite a major transformation to Destiny‚Äôs social space, everything remains business as usual
 Destiny 2‚Äôs Tower got engulfed in a darkness called the Endless Night at the start of Season of the Splicer. But with the weekly reset on June 22, things got considerably worse. The main Tower plaza is now infested with Taken Blight and goop. But the civilians of the Tower, even characters like Commander Zavala or Lord Shaxx, have nothing to say about it. 
When I first landed in the Tower this week, the change was obvious. There‚Äôs a giant Taken ball floating in-between the walkways in the Courtyard ‚Äî you can actually stand on it for a great view of the the Traveler. There are more Blight balls scattered around the Courtyard, and Taken goop just bubbling on the ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Destiny 2‚Äôs Tower is covered in Taken Blight, but the NPCs don‚Äôt seem to notice

articles.description:
Image: Cold Iron Studios/20th Century Games
    

  
Aliens: Fireteam is now Aliens: Fireteam Elite
 The three-player cooperative survival shooter set in the Alien universe, Aliens: Fireteam Elite, will arrive Aug. 24, for PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Windows PC (via Steam), Xbox One, and Xbox Series X. 20th Century Games and Cold Iron Studios announced the release date for Aliens: Fireteam Elite on Wednesday, also revealing the game‚Äôs adjusted name (it was previously known as just Aliens: Fireteam).
The game costs $39.99 and offers four story-driven campaigns and customizable Colonial Marines. A deluxe edition of Aliens: Fireteam Elite will cost $69.99, and includes four cosmetic DLC bundles that will include class kit skins, weapon colors, and head accessories, as part of the game‚Äôs Endeavor Pass. The Endeavor Veteran Pack includes even more cosmetic items, and is included with the deluxe edition. The publisher also promises ‚Äúfree major gameplay updates.‚Äù
Players who pre-order Aliens: Fireteam Elite will get the Hardened Marine Pack, which includes additional cosmetics, including the ‚ÄúChestburster‚Äù emote and a bandana that will complete your Private Vasquez look.
Aliens: Fireteam Elite sends teams of three Colonial Marines on a variety of interstellar bug hunts where they‚Äôll face Xenomorphs of all stripes, deadly Weyland-Yutani synthetics, and other threats on far-off planets. Players must team up and strategize to take on waves of enemies, Left 4 Dead style, employing tactical roles and customizable soldiers. You can read Polygon‚Äôs preview of Aliens: Fireteam Elite for further details.
articles.title: The new Aliens co-op shooter arrives in August, with a new name

articles.description:
I pushed ‚Äúrandom‚Äù on my avatar creator and came up with ... well, I think he looks like Reggie Fils-Aime! So I stayed with this guy, who‚Äôs pretty good at Olympic Games Tokyo 2020‚Äôs hammer throw | Image: Sega
    

  
Serious fun with room for silliness among friends, too
 Olympics video games of the non-Mario-&-Sonic type have had a negligible appeal over the past, oh, IV or V Olympiads. The format itself ‚Äî dividing players‚Äô attention among several events instead of focusing on one ‚Äî presents a big challenge to developers. And the fact that TV coverage fixates more on athletes and their stories than the events or their results certainly does not help set players‚Äô expectations.
Mine were low coming into Sega‚Äôs Olympic Games Tokyo 2020, the publisher‚Äôs first swing at a Summer Olympics since ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Sega‚Äôs Olympics 2020 video game is a very pleasant surprise

articles.description:
Image: Bandai Namco Studios/Bandai Namco Entertainment
    


  
The characters and story of Bandai Namco‚Äôs JRPG sealed the deal
 Sequels and spinoffs are everywhere in games. That‚Äôs because creating something new can be risky. Scarlet Nexus, Bandai Namco‚Äôs upcoming role-playing game, surprised me. It has a strong foundation as a potential future franchise, with an above-average narrative and fun gameplay and characters. 
The game takes place in a fictional country called New Himuka that has been invaded by dangerous creatures called Others. These creatures fall from the sky, part of a phenomenon called the Extinction Belt. Society has been able to utilize a certain ‚Äúpsionic hormone‚Äù in the human brain that allows people to develop supernatural powers, such as cryokinesis and air manipulat‚Ä¶
articles.title: The haunting twists of Scarlet Nexus make it a surprise gem

articles.description:

Banjo-Kazooie: Nuts & Bolts and Prodeus, too
 A new slate of games is coming to Xbox Game Pass in the next two weeks, including Limbo, Gang Beasts, and Worms Rumble. Xbox Game Pass community lead Megan Spurr announced the upcoming additions in a post on the Xbox Wire Wednesday.

Grinding out Monster Hunter Stories 2 makes for a chill weekend
 Monster Hunter Stories 2: Wings of Ruin manages to pack all the odd quirks from the Monster Hunter series into a Pok√©mon-like turn-based RPG for Nintendo Switch and PC. It‚Äôs a bizarre combination, but it works. 
I played the first few hours of Monster Hunter Stories 2: Wings of Ruins on Switch using a code from Capcom. But despite the game‚Äôs focus on story, the grind of Monster Hunter Stories 2: Wings of Ruin has been the most compelling and gripping aspect for me.
